article_title: South Africa Shrugs as Artists Try to Turn It Avant-Garde
article_text:
JOHANNESBURG—When Anthea Moys stepped onto a soccer field to play an 11-man squad, the other team's coach, Wandile Duruwe, commented: "She couldn't kick the ball. She couldn't run. She was unfit."

That was the point. After 10 minutes, the score was 5-0. In the second half spectators took the field to lend a hand. She still lost...

twitter.description: Performance artists confront an extra dose of bewilderment in South Africa, a nation less accustomed to the whimsical world of public and performance art than the U.S. or Europe.
twitter.title: South Africa Shrugs as Artists Try to Turn It Avant-Garde

image.alt: Performance artists confront an extra dose of bewilderment in South Africa, a nation less accustomed to the whimsical side of art world
